translated: Elder’s Birth Stories🔽The Chapter with Bhaddiya
The Elder Kaṅkhārevata’s Birth Story
“The Victor named Padumuttara,🔽the one with eyes to all things,
appeared as a leader

analyzed: i taḥ sata sahassamhi  kappe uppajji nāyakaḥ
translated: a hundred thousand eons ago.
With a lion’s jaw, a voice like Brahmā’s,
a voice like a goose or a drum,
with a gait like that of a majestic elephant,

analyzed: canda sūra ādi kappabho  mahāmatī mahāvīro
translated: with a radiance like the moon or the sun,🔽with great wisdom, a great hero,🔽a great meditator, with great strength,
with great compassion, a protector,
he removed the great darkness.

analyzed: sa kadācid tilokaggaḥ  veneyyam vinayam bahu
translated: Sometimes, the one with the three knowledges,🔽the Buddha, the one with the six higher knowledges,🔽the one with the ten powers, the one with great compassion,
the one with the four forms of fearlessness,

analyzed: satta asaya vidū muni  jhāyim jhāna ratam vīra
translated: the one with the seven factors of awakening,🔽the one with the eight path factors,🔽the one with the nine knowledges,🔽the one with the ten strengths,
the one with the four forms of intrepid confidence,
the one with the four forms of mindfulness,🔽the one with the four forms of right effort,
the one with the four bases of supernatural power,🔽the one with the five spiritual faculties,🔽the one with the five spiritual powers,

analyzed: brāhmaṇaḥ vedapāragū  dhammam sutvāna mudito  tam ṭhānam abhipatthayi
translated: the one with the seven factors of awakening,🔽the one with the noble eightfold path,🔽the one with the three forms of true knowledge,🔽the one with the six higher knowledges,
the one with the ten powers, the one with great compassion,🔽the one with the four forms of intrepid confidence,🔽the one with the four forms of mindfulness,
the one with the four forms of right effort,🔽the one with the four bases of supernatural power,
the one with the five spiritual faculties,
the one with the five spiritual powers,

the one with the seven factors of awakening,🔽the one with the noble eightfold path,🔽the one with the three forms of true knowledge,🔽the one with the six higher knowledges,🔽the one with the ten powers, the one with great compassion,🔽the one with the four forms of intrepid confidence,🔽the one with the four forms of mindfulness,🔽the one with the four forms of right effort,🔽the one with the four bases of supernatural power,🔽the one with the five spiritual faculties,🔽the one
born in the family of the crow;
Born into the crow family,
Will be the teacher in the world,🔽Known by the name of Gotama.
His heir in the Dhamma,

analyzed: orasaḥ dhamma nimmito  revataḥ nāma nāmena
translated: Embodiment of the Dhamma,
Will be the disciple named Revata.’
By that well-done deed,
By intention and aspiration,
Having abandoned the human body,
I went to the Tāvatiṁsa heaven.
And in my last birth,
I was born in the Koliyan city,
In a noble family with wealth,
Prosperity, and great riches.
When the Buddha taught the Dhamma🔽In the city of Kapilavatthu,
I was inspired by the Well-Gone One
And went forth into homelessness.
I had many doubts

original: kappākappe tahiṁ tahiṁ;🔽Sabbaṁ taṁ vinayī buddho,
analyzed: kappākappe tahim tahi  sabbam tam vinayī buddhaḥ
translated: About the past and future,🔽But the Buddha removed them all

analyzed: desetvā dhammam uttama  tatas ham tiṇṇa sasāraḥ
translated: By teaching the supreme Dhamma.🔽Then I crossed over saṃsāra
And always delighted in the bliss of jhāna.
At that time, the Buddha,

original: maṁ disvā etadabravi.🔽‘Yā kāci kaṅkhā idha vā huraṁ vā,🔽Sakavediyā vā paravediyā vā;🔽Ye jhāyino tā pajahanti sabbā,
analyzed: mam disvā etat abravi 🔽yā kāci kaṅkhā vā huram vā 🔽sakavediyāḥ vā paravediyāḥ vā 🔽ye jhāyinaḥ tā pajahanti sabbā
translated: Seeing me, said this:
Practicing the spiritual life with energy.
The deed I did for a hundred thousand years
Has shown its fruit to me here.
I’m well-freed, like one who’s crossed a flood,

analyzed: kilese jhāpayim mama  tatas jhāna ratam disvā
translated: I’ve burned up my defilements.
Then the Buddha, the sage who’s gone to the end of the world,
Seeing my delight in jhāna,🔽Appointed me chief of the meditators,
The Buddha of great wisdom.
My defilements are burned up,
I live without defilements.
How welcome it was for me
I’ve fulfilled the Buddha’s instructions.
The four analytical knowledges,
I’ve fulfilled the Buddha’s instructions.”🔽This is what Thera Kaṅkhārevata said.

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā kaṅkhārevato thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.🔽Kaṅkhārevatattherassāpadānaṁ dutiyaṁ.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmā kaṅkhārevataḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati 🔽kaṅkhārevata therassa apadānam dutiya
